comment.text:
cooks and soliders is a popular tapas spot in west midtown and has been on my list to try for a long time now. the vibe is great and place is spacious. the service is solid and very friendly. some of the tapas were hit or miss for me. i saw a ton of pics of the bikini which made me order it (i likely wouldn't have ordered it otherwise). the bikini was the star of the show for me. it was like an adult Spanish grilled cheese. so simple yet delicious. i wasn't a huge fan of the patatas bravas. i thought they were a little too large for me and not super crispy. i personally like them when they're quartered. the gambas were pretty good, but wish it came with more! i also really enjoyed the berenjenas. it reminded me a lot of a Mediterranean dish with the wood grilled eggplant and crispy chickpeas. 

overall, it was a good experience and dinner. if i came again, i would probably order different items and maybe even venture out into non-tapas items.

This was a very interesting experience. I'll separate this review and rate the food and the service separately. I'll start with the better end which is the food. This menu is not really very suited for someone like me that doesn't eat red meat but I was pleasantly surprised that the few options I did have were done to perfection. I ordered the Marmitako which is ahi tuna and a bite of this halted my who conversation with my friend because it was so good. The seasoning was just perfect along with the sauce and the little potatoes in it were so yummy. I also had the gambas al  ajillo which is garlic shrimp and again, this was done to perfection. I should've stopped there. I ordered the cheesecake and it was odd then it was bad. The strawberries tasted like smoked meat and it was gross. I was so disappointed because dessert is my favorite part. Overall I gave the food a 4  because the dessert was bad. My friend's lemon bar was odd too because the crust was not good. But she liked all her main food too and was able to order way more than me. 
The staff needed help. Never really felt welcome and the greeters with the exception of the main one I spoke with were not very professional or pleasant. Our server made us feel like we were a nuisance for wanting to order and for a tapas restaurant that is a normal thing to keep adding more items. It seemed like he and many of the other workers didn't want to be there. So based on the service I'd give that side a 2. 
So even tho my mains were sooooo yummy, based on the staff it is very unlikely I would return.
Service was slow.  Bar was crowded though.  Drinks were okay. We didn't eat this time, but the food at C&S is really good.

Invited by a female friend to accompany her and a large group. Prior to this we were at Painted Duck and everyone kept talking about how they couldn't wait for dinner.... A little did I know I couldn't wait either after arriving and being seated at a large table with low lights and candles on the table the mood was set. This is a perfect place for date night or to get a drink or two. 

The food was delicious and I will most certainly come back soon!

Really wonderful tapas restaurant in ATL. We had the bikini (fancy grilled cheese), scallops, potatoes bravas, and sea salt bread. Wonderful place for a business meeting if you go early. Our service was excellent! 

Be prepared for valet parking

Came to cooks and soldiers for a joint friends' birthday dinner and I was definitely impressed! It's fancy, but not overpriced and there's free valet parking attached to the restaurant. 

Our waitress was awesome and gave us complimentary wine to start to celebrate the birthdays. For entrees, we decided to share 11 plates between 6 of us. My favorites were the patatas bravas, bone marrow, mountain bread, and chistorra in a blanket (basically fancy pigs in a blanket with an amazing honey mustard sauce), but most of what we had was pretty good. 

For dessert we split everything on the menu with the rest of the party and my favorite one was the basque cheesecake followed closely by the orange pie. After meals and dessert, the total came to around $50 per person, which isn't too bad for a nice dinner out. 

Overall I would recommend cooks and soldiers for a nice dinner and will definitely add this to my list of favs!

Went on a Friday around 8pm. This place is noisy! If that suits your vibe then you'll be fine but I was there with people I really wanted to chat with and that was nearly impossible. 

I no longer eat red meat so at first glance the menu was discouraging but I found some winners!

Here's what I tried and my ratings, 5 being excellent:

Appetizers:

PIPERADE
Basque pepper stew, fried egg, wild mushroom,
sourdough (4 out of 5)

PAN DE SETAS
Smoked local mushrooms, black truffle,
goat cheese crème fraîche, sourdough (5 out of 5)


Main Entrees:

PESCADO À LA PARILLA
Whole market fish, mojo rojo, fried garlic (4 out of 5)

POLLO BASQUAISE
Half chicken, saffron piperade (5 out of 5)

BROCCOLINI
Tonnato, manchego, grilled lemon, espelette (4 out of 5)

BERENJENAS
Coal roasted eggplant, tahini yogurt, salsa verde,
crispy chickpea, caramelized honey (5 out of 5) 



Dessert
Cheesecake (taste weird. 1 out of 5)
Orange cake slice (4 out of 5)
Chocolate galato (2 out of 5)

I would not recommend this place for desserts!

photos.caption: PESCADO À LA PARILLA - Whole market fish

comment.text:
We've heard amazing things about Cooks & Soldiers and decided to finally try it out and it did not disappoint. I feel that it's important to begin with these are the best tapas potatoes you'll ever have. Don't mess with the Barcelona potatoes down the street,  these have the most amazing crisp. 

We also had a number of great tapas, mussels (sauce was slap your mama good), the octopus (pretty damn good with the perfect char), crudo (good but fishy), those little grilled cheese sammies that had amazing truffle rubbed all over them. 

The cocktails are amazing as well, I had the best gin and tonic of my life (not even kidding)

I came across this restaurant on a whim and boy was a I happy that I did! This was the best service I have ever had. I have never encountered such kind and personable staff! They gave us some drink suggestions based on our personal tastes, and stopped by to make sure everything was alright. And the food!! The barbacoa had a burst of flavor, and was so tender. The bikini was delicious, but I would have preferred a little less truffle oil since the excess would seep in my mouth with every bite. All in all, this was such a great experience, and I definitely plan on coming back!
Great drinks. Probably some of the best in Atlanta! Food is ok. Ambiance is nice! Service is pretty nice as well. We always sit at the bar and almost all of the bartenders are great!

Very lively and fun space for a celebration! 
Small shareable plates, tasty and innovative. A great cocktail drink menu- well categorized from sweet to drink heavy (I love this for those who like sweeter drinks but don't want to ask the server many questions around them) 
I always receive excellent service as the staff is knowledgeable, friendly and know the products well from experiencing them. 
My only suggestion is to have larger tables as they fill up when you have more than three plates.

Came here with a group of friends and it was really fun! We had the server put together an order of random tapas off the menu for us because we couldn't decide and figured he would know best. He did a great job and we got to taste dishes we might not have ordered otherwise. We had great seating and the food and drinks were delicious. I'm glad this place is still going well and definitely more fun coming with a group so you can try a variety of items! This time we took an Uber there and it was easier than figuring out parking.

Service and Food were impeccable.  Scallops with corn, shrimp with sour dough, a veal special with crispy chanterelles and the burnt cheesecake were all perfection.  Great service and a visit from an owner to ask about our experience...it was memorable.

I went for happy hour with a group of 4 on a Tuesday. The deals for happy hour aren't that great. They have $5 gin & tonics, which is nice, but for food, they only offer 3 different bites (literal bites) of food for $1, and you can only get one bite per drink.

I got the Vegetarian Bikini (grilled cheese with truffle, $9). It was very, very good. I dipped it in the Ibérico Albondigas sauce and that was delicious too.

Note on parking - valet at the deck off of 14th street and get your ticket validated at the host stand. Valet took cash, card, and even Venmo. Valet closes when the restaurant closes.

Cool atmosphere. Nice light fixtures. Good for a date!

While I won't go again for happy hour, I'll definitely go back to try more items on the menu! Their cocktails looked really good, so I can't wait to try those!

Cooks & Soldiers has a very social, buzzing atmosphere. All of the plates were good, except the risotto was too salty. Service was a bit slow and the plates came out ill-paced for a tapas restaurant. It seems like a fun place to have a night out with friends.

This place is a must go, and then repeat! We made reservations and were seated promptly. The service was on point. There are so many mouthwatering food options to choose from. We had several options and were pleased by them all! Definitely a great date night place. Highly recommended

Upscale tapas restaurant in west midtown. We really loved the selection of different foods and options. Cocktails impressed us all. Tapas is a great option but they also have a large selection of meats and cheeses. 
Very authentic Spanish style tapas and foods.

Food was fantastic and service was great!  We went on a Saturday night to celebrate our daughter's college graduation and thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. There were 4 in our group, and we started with the Ensalada, Pork Cheek Croquetas, and Bikini. For our main course, we shared the Ribeye, Hongos (mushrooms), Camote (sweet potatoes), Berenjenas (eggplant). All sides were a great compliment to the beef.  Everything was very flavorful and absolutely delicious.

This is one of my fav tapas places! My most favorite dish here is the grilled cheese (bikini). Just go ahead & order 2 plates of that. It's so delicious! Almost every dish I've had here is well worth it, and the prices are not TOO outrageous. Parking is easy -- there is valet parking in the deck. The drinks are also very tasty and refreshing. Loved it!

I'll keep this one short: wasn't impressed! We tried a bunch of items and the food just wasn't that great. We were delivered wrong items several times. What was confusing is the food looks appealing but the flavors just weren't there. I'd try somewhere else next time.

Made a reservation (highly recommend) for dinner here for 3. They called the day before to confirm the reservation. My friends got there earlier and it was easy for them to get seated. They had several drinks each which they enjoyed but I chose not to partake tonight. The ambience of the restaurant feels quite hip and trendy but also classy. Exactly the spot you would want if you were there for a birthday or a special occasion or a date.

We got a multitude of dishes. The scallops were the most average of the dishes. It didn't have the sear or flavor I would like in a scallop and the sauce didn't do much for the dish. This would be the only dish I would pass on. The mountain bread had a nice texture and came with a lovely butter. The butter was slightly on the saltier side for my taste but not to the point where I didn't enjoy it. The beef tongue which is a special currently (they have a small side menu of specials) was delicious. It had a beautiful sear outside and had a lovely soft texture inside. The bone marrow was solid, though the bone we got wasn't very deep and I didn't feel like we got our monies worth compared to other peoples bones but that's a small point.  The Argentinians shrimp dish was okay in terms of the texture of the shrimp. The real star of the dish was the sauce it came with, the shrimp sauce paired very well with the bread it came with. I would recommend dish solely for the sauce! One of my favorite for the night was the mushroom toast. It had a delicious creamy element from the cheese and a nice meaty texture from the mushrooms. It also had a great earthly profile from the truffle. The croquetas are exactly what you want to see, a nice crispy exterior with a creamy interior. The sauce it came with was good to dip in and paired well. Finally we ended the night with the 32 oz steak and a basque style cheesecake. The steak was perfectly cooked and the jus it came with was really nice. I liked how it had some lightly dressed veggies on the side which served as a good palette cleanser. The steaks crust was slightly too salty for my taste in some bites. The cheesecake was okay. It has a more rough texture than a new york style cheesecake. I thought it was something that people should try since it's a famous Basque dessert but I wouldn't try it again.

The service was acceptable here. They were really on top of the drinks. They were slow with my water and my coke zero refills. Overall, a really amazing place to try a variety of dishes. I think it's one of the better restaurants in Atlanta.

One of my top restaurants in the city actually top 10 . Food , Ambience and Service are stellar . They have a grilled fish that is amazing and Spatchcock Chicken that's Phenomenal. They grill everything and it's worth it trust me go and say thanks and invite me so I can eat on your tab

First meal in Atlanta and we were thoroughly impressed :)

We ordered the smoked mushroom toast, paella, and pulpo. The paella was amazing; the seafood tasted so fresh and and the rice was perfectly creamy and seasoned. The Pulpo was tender and topped with so many yummy garnishes. The toast was really tasty as well!
We also ordered a lavender gin & tonic (which was huge for the price).
For dessert we got the basque cheesecake, and it was just as good as it looks.

Highly recommend; better than a lot of the Spanish tapa spots we have at home in California!

We went to Cooks & Soldiers for a double date with old friends and it was one of the best Spanish experiences outside of Spain! They have an interesting menu with tons of Tapas. I also love the upscale rustic atmosphere. Very Spain.

We ended up just ordering from the Pintxos menu and splitting each dish four ways (which worked great!) We had so many that I cannot comment on them all but I will say that our favorites were the Bikini Grilled Cheese and Pork Cheek Croquetas. 

Though I don't drink, the beer and wine list was extensive. They also had some great cocktails. This is definitely a place to come spend a few hours to drink and eat (just as the Spanish intended).

Spanish food is hard to find so this place is a hidden gem in Atlanta. Definitely give it a try. I want to go back to try everything I didn't eat.

photos.caption: Bikini Pintxo (Grilled Cheese w Truffle Oil)
Chistorra Envuelta (lies pigs in a blanket)
View of the bar as you walk in

comment.text:
My date and I really enjoyed ourselves at Cooks and Soldiers!
Hostess staff welcomed me with smiling faces and informed me that my table would be ready shortly. I decided to have a glass of champagne while I waited for my date to arrive,the bartender was very welcoming.
After closing out my bar tab, the hostess escorted us to our table. Our waitress, Jo, was very attentive and made sure to answer all of our questions.
Literally everything was delicious! GAMBAS, CHISTORRA IN A BLANKET for starters. Main course I enjoyed the whole Bronzino and my date had the half chicken and shared the PATATAS BRAVAS.
In addition to champagne, I REALLY loved the Costa Verde. Super cute and yummy!
All the food came out in a timely manner.
I'll definitely be returning! Five stars!

I don't know how I missed writing a review for this spot. It's located in West Midtown. It's on the corner of 14th street and Howell Mill road. They offer valet parking located on the first level of the garage attached off of 14th street. 

 My sister and I opted to dine here on a Friday evening. We came in without reservations. I would NOT recommend doing this. While we were able to be seated in the bar area, you may not have the same luck. 

Our server was awesome! He had a great personality. He advised us of his favorite items on the menu. I was already going to order 2 of his recommendations.  when I came on a prior occasion I had the Bikini and it was the  best grill cheese sandwich I have ever had in my entire life!  The other option I had already picked out was the smoked mushroom toast. His third suggestion was the Gambas, which is a shrimp dish. 

The food came out in no time. Our first dish to arrive was the smoked mushroom toast ( my favorite  of the three dishes). The menu describes this dish as local mushrooms: black truffle, goat cheese crème fraiche, sourdough. The combination of all the flavors work. There is a slight taste of truffle that makes this dish special! It's a must try. 

My  next favorite item was the bikini.  We did opt to get the vegetarian version of this dish.  The traditional bikini does have pork in it. The vegetarian bikini description is white cheddar grilled cheese, black truffle, white bread. A little history on the bikini sandwich: it's a Barcelona classic pressed ham and cheese sandwich. It is named after the Bikini hall in Barcelona. Ok, now that we know where the name came from let's discuss  how amazing the rendition from Cooks and Soldiers is.  This sandwich is simple perfection! I don't know if it's the butter perfectly toasted in the head or the quality of the cheese, but this sandwich will have you wanting more! 

While I also enjoyed the shrimp dish, it just does not compare to the first two I mentioned. However  it is a solid dish and worth ordering. 

Overall, this spot is one of my favorites in the city. It has a sexy ambiance with low lighting  throughout, amazing food and recommendable service is provided.  If you check it out, I can't imagine you being disappointed.

Awesome food 
Don't like the noise atmosphere 
If on a date. 
Parking is a bit hard to get to  at the Howellmill location.
Get the grilled cheese and thank me later. Great place for a date night. Awesome sharables.
Absolutely delicious and they have vegetarian options. Liked the ambiance as well. Decent prices. Lovely location

Friday night and it's busy!
Tried a few new things...

Mushroom toast
Duck confit

Tomato toast
Tuna- soooooo good!!! My fav!

Lemon bar

Everything was delicious!   Just make sure you don't order to many things on bread or it fills you up.

owner_replies.comment:
Rene,

It was great to have you back in the dining room! And thank you for sharing this feedback!  We look forward to welcoming you again soon.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: Great service! I loved all the food but don't get the stuffed  peppers unless you love meatloaf. Highly recommend the patas bravas and the scallops

I am a sucker for tapas and Cooks & Soldiers didn't disappoint. We had a great server who helped us understand the menu and steered us in the right direction. Everything was good but there were some stand out favorites. I'll rank them in AHMAYZING and Good:

AHMAYZING:
Pulpo a la Gallega: Octopus was delicious, cooked perfectly and really flavorful 

Smoked Mushroom Toast: Surprisingly, this was my favorite - and I don't even like mushrooms. The goat cheese creme was so smooth and the mushrooms were really flavorful

Patatas Bravas: At first I was like, okay they are fried potatoes. BUT! They were so much more. The sauce was amazing and the texture was really delicious and unique. 

Cordero Estofado: This is the lamb shoulder. It was cooked amazingly, just fell apart with your fork and the farro added some great texture. Also one of the larger plates 

Good: 
Escabeche de Atun: This is the bluefin tuna. It had good flavor, but wasn't super impressed

Steak dish: I can't remember the name, but it was on the specials. It was a little chewy and just meh. 

Mezcal drink: Also a good not great, nothing unique. 

A great experience and we had more dishes we loved then not. It is decently pricy, but figured that since it's tapas. I would go back to try even more!

owner_replies.comment:
Nadia,

It is wonderful to read this recap of your dining experience with us. Thank you for taking a moment to memorialize it all.  We hope to serve you again soon.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
Only been there once.
And might not have been lucky. Drink's were nice, food was so so, for the price, and we had the grilled octopus.
We had to send it back. They did not charge us for it. 
Ambiance super nice. Service was good.

We found out about this place through the Heritage Fire tour where they served the most incredible paella and generous servings of wine.   Even though paella isn't on their regular menu, what is on the menu is outstanding across the board.  Their pan con tomate with the ham add on is a must order every time I go there.  We really liked the pork cheek croquetas, and the Pollo Basquaise was amazing.  Since I'm not much of a dairy eater, there was a roasted carrot side dish that sounded great but I wasn't a fan of the sauce.  Our waiter suggested they could sub it out with a Romesco sauce and it was probably the best Romesco sauce I've tasted.  

Since we're huge fans of Cooks & Soldiers, my wife and I never pass up an excuse to have happy hour there if we're anywhere remotely near the area.  The happy hour is pretty basic - $5 gin and tonics from a selection of 3 plus a $1 add on for a bite, but we'll always throw in an appetizer from the regular menu for one of the tastiest happy hours in town.

This place is over priced for the food. You will spend a lot and still leave hungry. The service, location, and  ambiance was good though. The best thing I'm the menu is the grilled cheese - will be the best grilled cheese you ever have. Glad I tried this place But all in all, I won't be back
Nice atmosphere. Not too busy on a Saturday night (but we were there early; 5:15). Very attentive staff. Good, tasty food, but not spectacular.

We had a nice meal and good service. It is tapas style so be prepared to order 2-4 of each item when sharing to have enough food. Lots of interesting choices and gluten free choices. Everything is cooked in a Spanish style. We loved the smoked entrees but thought it was used just a little too much. Although, the smoked mushrooms were fabulous. I liked the grilled octopus but I was the only one. Our waitress was knowledgeable and helped a lot in guiding as to how much to order. The rest of the group raved about the mountain bread, so don't miss that.

photos.caption: Mountain Bread-friends said it was one of the best breads they had ever had!!
Grilled octopus-I liked it but no one else did.

comment.text:
I came to C&S, a high end Basque Style Tapas bar, to celebrate 7 months of hard work on a Client who treated me to one heck of a farewell party. Our host made all the selections and boy did she set up a nice spread!  When i arrived the table was set with various charcuterie, fresh made bread with salted butter, different sausage, and meats and cheeses.

I ordered a nice fruity drink with tequila in it and sweet pepper corns. Truly amazing!

The tapas dishes served put us all over the top from the tomahawk steak to the octopus to the miniature filling bikinis.

The ambiance is modern and fancy, and when I left valet parking conveniently took care of my car.

Can't wait to take the family here for a special night.

owner_replies.comment:
Frederick,

Thank you for choosing to celebrate this occasion at Cooks & Soldiers.  It was our pleasure to serve you and we hope to see you again soon!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
I love CHG and I was anxious for a first time meal here. My friend and I had no problem grabbing a table and our server Jeannette was the sweetest. Truly amazing service, new place settings after nearly every dish made for a clean table at all times. What really blew me away was the food, so inventive and delicious. Everything I had was amazing but here's my ranking of the tapas we had. 

Chistorra Invuelta- the crescent was so fresh and light
Pork Cheek Croquetas 
Barbacoa 
Lobster Fideos
Bikini
Piquillos Rellenos
Patatas Bravas
Gambas
Basque Cheesecake 

Even the low ranking tapas were yummy don't get me wrong but the top 5 you NEED to get. Especially the Chistorra.

Nice spot in midtown! Very busy area but luckily there is valet parking and self park garage parking across from the restaurant. We walked in and sat at the bar, which is pretty large so if you don't have a reservation there's a good chance you can get a seat at the bar. Taylor was the behind the bar and she was awesome! She knows all about the food and drinks. The ambiance is very nice and the food was good! It's tapas so you will need to order multiple plates. It was two of us and we ordered about 10 items which was more than enough. I'll definitely be back!

I've been wanting to dine here for a while so made a resy last Sunday and went. The ambiance was nice for an evening dining experience. Our waiter for very knowledgeable about the menu and making recommendations. He recommended the Bikini for an appetizer which is a grilled cheese & ham sandwich. For my entree I had the Barbacoa with a sized of mushrooms. The mushrooms were coal roasted and had a burnt flavor to them so I wasn't a fan of them, but the short rib was great.
If you know going in that the nature of their menu means you're there awhile (it takes time to cook some menu items) and that it is very meat focused, you're in for a treat. Excellent service.

Hey Peeps. The royal rib and I hit Atl and had a ball. We stopped by this wonderful restaurant. The food was delicious, the atmosphere was lively, and the service was patient. A bit of advice.  1. Don't be in hurry and go with someone who you enjoy because there will be a wait. Also, do some homework on the restaurant and menu. I didn't or would have ordered better. But what I did have was scrumptious. The restaurant is also located in a wonderful part of Atlanta with shops and nice scenery. When I'm Atl. Check it out. #Pkast

photos.caption: Pescado a la Parilla* Whole wood grilled market fish, mojo rojo, fried garlic

comment.text:
Amazing! I really like the restaurant's vibe, food, and prices. I genuinely really like the staffs', well, genuineness. I don't at all like the fake snobby smiles and forced customer service just bc you have to.

Since we went to Iberian Pig before (same owners), the hubs took me here for some pre-Valentines dinner. The atmosphere is different here, bathed in low light versus a dim, bar-like atmosphere with Iberian Pig.

Cana klasikoa: The charred goat cheese was presented with sprinkles of pistachio, roasted tomatoes and green pepper chunks with red onions on a slice of mountain bread. The slight smokiness of the cheese made this more interesting.

Mussel escabeche: The marinated mussels also sat upon a slice of mountain bread. These seemed almost to be chilled mussels with what appears to be crunchy water chestnuts (?). The fennel gave it a nice color with perhaps sobrassada being the base?

Bikini: What's in a name? A fancy grilled cheese: White cheddar grilled cheese, Spanish ham, black truffle on white bread. The gooey cheese and oil was oh so good, but since this came later in the meal, our faces couldn't handle the extra calories. Don't get me wrong, it was good!

Basque montadito: This was a sandwich: chorizo, bayonne ham, green tomato tapenade with spiced chips. I think this was the least interesting choice as we couldn't figure out what it was at first. The chorizo isn't in the usual form we had imagined. Though it was good, it wasn't as interesting as the others -- just a normal looking sandwich with chips.

Pimiento relleno: Poblano, smoked mushroom on manchego cheese and romesco sauce. This was no doubt the hub's fav as he's into mushrooms. It's the most unique and interesting looking dish with unique flavors as well. It looked like two black things with smeared peanut butter, chocolate sauce, and peanut pieces if you were to describe it from a child's perspective. Lol.

Pulpo: Spanish octopus with roasted chestnuts, gigante bean on potato puree along with a 68 degree yolk, and I suppose the paprika pistou made it flavorful. The unique item choices really spiced up the octopus and made it even better. The potato puree and yolk were different and paired well together. Who would have thought.

Iberico smash burger: A pork and beef patty with manchego cheese, garlic aioli, guindilla pickles, and lettuce on an onion bun. Though it's a burger at the end of the day, the flavors and distinct ingredients made it stand out. This was filling if that's what you're going for despite being its size. As it was the last dish that came out, we couldn't finish the bread, but it was superb.

I would definitely give this place another visit! I was quite impressed and pleased with everything, hence the five star review. And only places that give me those initial wowing moments get five stars from me. :)

owner_replies.comment:
Andrea,

Thank you for taking the time to write this detailed review about your experience.  Thank you for sharing the feedback and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: Loved it. Derek really made our experience great. Had dinner with a girlfriend and wanted to chat and catch up. We never felt rushed, Derek recommended a great bottle of wine for us to gossip and chat over. The tapas were great! The croquettes were so delicious-got two orders. The tartare was divine and honestly had no complaints. Place was a bit moody which made it fun. Loved it. Will be going back.

By far one of the best restaurants in Atlanta! I am obsessed. The drinks, food, and service are amazing. You literally can't go wrong with anything on the menu, like literally order it all! Ambiance top notch for a nice dinner or dinner before going out but again the food.... I will be dreaming about it every night and it's my new favorite place in Atlanta

We had a blast!   We came in as a larger table for two birthdays on Friday night. And our server was awesome!  She suggested we order 2-3 of each tapas that we were interested in so that everyone could try it. And to order a couple of the larger proteins for the table. And she was spot-on. We tried some really cool items - Octopus and the best grilled cheese sandwich I've ever tried that had ham and truffle oil in it. Yum!  The drinks were tasty and the wine was delicious and our entire group enjoyed our dinner!  Will definitely come back again for a date night soon!!

We love all restaurants owned by this group. Tapas are so fun if you're the type that likes to try a little bit of everything. Our favorite that we tried was the chistorra in a blanket, which is a fancier pig in a blanket with sausage in a croissant. We went the route of getting a larger main dish (filet mignon) to share, but I'd love to come back and try more tapas! I'd trust that anything on their menu is great. 

They offer free valet parking in the garage next door.

owner_replies.comment:
Bianca,

Thank you for being a loyal guest at The Castellucci Hospitality Group restaurants.  It is our pleasure to welcome you and we appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback.  We hope to see you again soon.

Take care,
Fred

comment.text:
Wow! What a fantastic dinner experience all around!

I recommend making a reservation here, as I could see it filling up quickly (especially on a weekend night). Cooks & Soldiers has complimentary valet parking, which is always something that I greatly appreciate. Prepare to be wowed as soon as you walk inside the restaurant - the ambiance is beautiful and romantic, and both the bar area and the dining room are super aesthetically pleasing. 

Our waitress was Alex and she was an absolute gem - very personable and gave excellent recommendations. Expect to share tapas (vs. ordering an individual entrée) in order to get the most out of your experience. We split four dishes among the two of us, which doesn't sound like much but left us feeling PLENTY full. More specifically, we got the bikini (mini truffle grilled cheese sandwiches - so satisfying), duck confit egg rolls (one of their NYE specials, very tasty), Ibérico Albondigas (a meatball dish - good but not mind blowing), and the gambas (red shrimp served with sourdough - BEST dish of the ones we ordered). If I wasn't so full, I would've loved to try more, as I'm sure everything would have been delicious!

For dessert, we ordered the cheesecake, which is not your typical cheesecake, but crust-less and much fluffier (almost like a Japanese cheesecake). Since we were there for a special occasion, they also brought us salted caramel ice cream on the house (with a candle) - such a sweet gesture! Both desserts were delectable. Highly recommend trying their desserts here, even if you're not a sweets person.

All in all, I very much enjoyed every aspect of my dinner at Cooks & Soldiers. Hope to come back soon!

photos.caption: Cheesecake (and complimentary salted caramel ice cream in the background!)

owner_replies.comment:
Christina,

Thank you for taking the time to share this detailed review! We loved to read your feedback and know that the experience at Cooks & Soldiers was a memorable one.  We look forward to our next opportunity to serve you!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
I've always loved coming here. The food is great and the service has always been top notch. I recently came here with a friend, and we sat on the patio. Ordered a few tapas and a couple of drinks. Staff wore gloves and masks, and the tables were spaced apart. We ordered the patatas bravas, gambas, chistorra in a blanket, and I believe they had a special of stuffed poblanos. Everything came out in a timely manner, and was delicious. Our waiter was attentive, but not overbearing (which is always welcomed).
I do recommend making a reservation. We came spur of the moment and most of the restaurant was reserved, and because of social distancing, spaces are limited.

photos.caption: Gambas (you might be able to see the patatas bravas in the back)

Thank you for taking a moment to share this feedback about Cooks & Soldiers!  It it always a pleasure to serve you.

Take care,

Fred
